abstract.t: This document defines Bitstream Transport over Ethernet (BToE), a method for capturing and transporting raw Layer 1 bitstream data across Ethernet Layer 2 networks. Unlike traditional frame-based transport mechanisms, BToE enables fully transparent transmission of physical layer signals, allowing for cable fault isolation, ASIC/FPGA debugging, and transceiver validation by preserving the integrity of all bits, including those outside valid Ethernet frames.
